article.headline: Butler 64, Ohio 63 (OT)
article.story: INDIANAPOLIS (AP) -- Ohio's Terren Harbut connected on a 3-pointer with two seconds left in overtime but it wasn't enough and Butler defeated the Bobcats 64-63 on Saturday. Butler (13-12) and Ohio were tied at 54 at the end of regulation after the Bobcats rallied back from a double-digit first-half deficit in the second half. Early in overtime, Ohio's Sonny Troutman made two free throws to give the Bobcats (9-16) a 56-54 edge. But the Bulldogs' Mike Monserez made a field goal to tie it at 56 and Butler outscored Ohio 8-7 the rest of the way for the win. Butler led most of the game, holding up to a 15-point advantage in the first half before the Bobcats rallied in the second half to grab up to a 5-point lead, 54-49 with 23 seconds in regulation, before a Monserez field goal and 3-pointer tied it at 54. The Bulldogs, who led Ohio 32-23 at the half, outrebounded the Bobcats 40-30 for the night. Duane Lightfoot and Bruce Horan led Butler with 14 points each, while Monserez and Avery Sheets added 10 each. Javion Harris led Ohio with a game-high 16 points, while Harbut added 15 and Thomas Stevens had 11.
